1. Overview of AetherAuth - behavioral proof of system
AetherAuth is a component of the SCBE-AETHERMOORE framework (Issac Davis, patent pending #63/961,403), designed as a "behavioral proof system" replacing static OAuth tokens with context-bound cryptographic envelopes. The system embeds 6D context vectors (time, IP, CPU/memory, intent, history) into a Poincaré ball to compute trust rings (CORE r<0.3, OUTER r>0.7, WALL), decrypts vaulted keys only when geometric conditions are met, and produces indistinguishable garbage on mismatch ("Fail-to-Noise").
